content: Got it. Looking forward to talking with the therapist.
I'm glad to hear that you're here and open to having this conversation. To start, how are you feeling today? Anything on your mind that you'd like to talk about?

I’ve been feeling drained, honestly. The stress at home has made it hard for me to focus or enjoy anything outside of it. My wife and I seem to be growing distant, and it feels like my family is falling apart.

That sounds incredibly tough. It must take a lot of emotional energy navigating stress at home and feeling that distance in your relationship. You’re carrying a heavy weight right now. What’s been helping you get through these feelings, if anything?

Honestly, nothing’s been helping. I feel like I’m just going through the motions without really coping. I don’t know what to do anymore—it’s like everything’s piling up, and I don’t have the energy to deal with it.

It sounds like you’re feeling overwhelmed, and the weight of everything is leaving you unsure of how to move forward. That can be such a hard place to be in, especially when it feels like you’re stuck in a cycle of just getting through each day. What do you think is impacting your energy the most right now?

I think it’s the situation with my son that’s really draining me. His behavioral issues are taking up so much time and emotional energy, and my wife and I can’t seem to agree on how to handle it. It’s making everything so much harder, including our marriage. I feel like I’m failing him and my family.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot of responsibility, and you're feeling torn between wanting the best for your son and the strain it’s putting on your relationship with your wife. Feeling like you’re falling short in such an important role must be incredibly painful. How have you been managing those feelings of guilt and frustration?

To be honest, I don’t think I’m really managing them at all. I bury them most of the time, but they just keep building up. I want to figure out how to be a better dad and a better partner, but I feel stuck.

It makes sense that burying those feelings might give some short-term relief, but they’re still weighing on you. The fact that you want to be a better dad and partner says a lot about how much you care—it’s clear your family is really important to you. What do you think being "better" in those roles might look like for you?
